p: Parkinsonism in GBA heterozygotes may be indistinguishable from iPD. However, they may have an earlier age at onset, more prevalent cognitive impairment, and may not respond to levodopa as well as iPD patients [ 54, 55]. GBA mutations are also associated with other alpha-synucleinopathies, including dementia with Lewy bodies [ 56] (pathologically confirmed) and, in some studies, with MSA [ 57– 61]. In contrast, there is no association with essential tremor or Alzheimer’s disease.
